Planes Grounded
$1000 Winner's Gibbon Adventure
Travel Tip
   
 

Hi %%First Name%%,

A flight can be cancelled for many reasons, but one of the most common is bad weather. Storms, flooding, ice, snow and even heatwaves all play their part. The trick for travellers is finding a way to protect those precious travel plans from these unexpected events.

For Kiwis it's an even bigger deal, because every trip abroad means travelling a long way from home. So delays could mean frustrating disruptions to your plans, and having to find costly emergency accommodation for you and your family. On the bright side, Southern Cross Travel Insurance has designed award-winning delay cover especially for Kiwis, to take care of those unexpected delay costs.

So our advice is, protect your travel plans now, and get your travel insurance early.

  
 
 
 
Travel Tip
Beware - Taxi drivers prey on tourists

A growing number of unscrupulous taxi drivers are taking advantage of unwary New Zealand travellers.

There are a number of scams to watch out for involving the stealing of luggage that include deception, deserting customers, and using accomplices. Find out what they're up to and how to protect yourself.
 
 
 
Gibbon adventure is a go!
An unforgettable adventure for one of our weekly $1,000 winners

When we told Scott Burton that he was our 11th winner this year he said "great news and perfect timing! We were just deciding whether to do the Gibbon Experience in Xai, Laos".

We really loved hearing about Scott's encounters, especially the 2 metre green viper!
